verses.kjv: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
verses.ct: This makes my heart pound and leap from its place.

verses.kjv: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
verses.ct: Listen carefully to the rumble of his voice, the sound that comes from his mouth.

verses.kjv: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
verses.ct: He sends it across the entire heavens, and his lightning reaches to the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
verses.ct: After it, his voice roars — he thunders with his majestic voice, and he doesn't hold back the lightning once his voice is heard.

verses.kjv: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
verses.ct: God thunders with his voice in amazing ways; he does great things that we cannot understand.

verses.kjv: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
verses.ct: He commands the snow, 'Fall on the earth,' and he tells the gentle rain and the heavy downpour to do the same.

verses.kjv: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
verses.ct: He stops everyone from working, so that all people will recognize what he has done.

verses.kjv: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
verses.ct: The wild animals retreat into their shelters and stay in their dens.

verses.kjv: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
verses.ct: The whirlwind comes from the south, and bitter cold from the north.

verses.kjv: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
verses.ct: God's breath produces ice, and wide bodies of water freeze solid.

verses.kjv: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
verses.ct: He loads the clouds with moisture and scatters his lightning through them.

verses.kjv: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
verses.ct: They swirl around at his direction, carrying out whatever he commands them across the surface of the whole world.

verses.kjv: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
verses.ct: He sends them either to punish, or to water his land, or to show mercy.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
verses.ct: Listen to this, Job — stop and think about the amazing things God does.

verses.kjv: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
verses.ct: Do you know how God arranges the clouds and makes lightning flash from them?

verses.kjv: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
verses.ct: Do you understand how the clouds are balanced in the sky — the wonders of the one whose knowledge is perfect?

verses.kjv: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
verses.ct: You know how your clothes feel hot when the earth grows still under the south wind —

verses.kjv: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?
verses.ct: but can you help him spread out the heavens, hard and solid like a polished bronze mirror?

verses.kjv: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
verses.ct: Tell us what we should say to him, because we can't even put together our arguments — we're in the dark.

verses.kjv: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
verses.ct: Should he be informed that I want to speak? If someone speaks up, they would surely be overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
verses.ct: Right now, no one can look at the bright light behind the clouds, but then the wind sweeps through and clears them away.

verses.kjv: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.
verses.ct: Golden splendor comes from the north — God is surrounded by awesome majesty.

verses.kjv: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.
verses.ct: The Almighty is beyond our reach; he is supreme in power, in justice, and in abundant righteousness — he does not oppress.

verses.kjv: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
verses.ct: That is why people deeply revere him — he has no regard for anyone who thinks they are wise on their own.
